holidays.name: National Zoo Lovers Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to appreciating the wonders of zoos and the work they do in wildlife conservation and education.
holidays.origin: Created by zoo enthusiasts and conservationists to promote awareness and visitation to zoos worldwide.
holidays.funFact: Many zoos host special events and activities on this day, including behind-the-scenes tours and animal feedings!

holidays.name: Draw a Bird Day
holidays.description: A quirky art holiday inviting people to grab their pencils and draw birds of any kind, celebrating creativity and nature.
holidays.origin: Started by artists and bird lovers to combine art and appreciation for birds.
holidays.funFact: You don’t have to be a skilled artist to join in — even the funniest, most imaginative bird drawings are encouraged!

holidays.name: International Day of Human Space Flight
holidays.description: Commemorates the first human space flight by Yuri Gagarin on April 12, 1961, celebrated around this week with space-related festivities.
holidays.origin: UN recognized day honoring human achievements in space exploration.
holidays.funFact: Yuri Gagarin’s famous exclamation during launch was, “Poyekhali!” meaning “Let’s go!” which has become a Russian space rally cry.

holidays.name: National Empanada Day
holidays.description: Celebrates the delicious empanada, a stuffed pastry popular in many Latin American and Spanish cuisines.
holidays.origin: A fun food holiday created to honor the diverse fillings and regional styles of empanadas.
holidays.funFact: There are over 100 varieties of empanadas worldwide, with fillings ranging from meat and cheese to sweet fruits!
